snippet.textDisplay: Pokemon are great deep strategy games disguised with a childish presentation
snippet.textOriginal: Pokemon are great deep strategy games disguised with a childish presentation

snippet.textDisplay: +Harkz0r not to mention the thought that went into breeding and hidden stats, which basically represent the biological concepts of inheritance and mutation as well as nature vs nurture.
snippet.textOriginal: +Harkz0r not to mention the thought that went into breeding and hidden stats, which basically represent the biological concepts of inheritance and mutation as well as nature vs nurture.

snippet.textDisplay:
+Carlos Pozo Unfortunately, IMO its over-reliance on random chance to determine critical moments (e.g. crithax, parahax, flinch hax etc) will prevent it from bridging the last gap it would need to become truly competitive. 

However, I do have to admit I greatly admire and respect Game Freak for what they managed to do - create a game that appeals to children, adolescents and adults alike, that withstands the test of time and without ever having to completely reinvent it (and no, I don't consider the engine changes in Gen 3 to be a reinvention). There is an astounding amount of depth beneath the cutesy surface.
snippet.textOriginal:

There is an astounding amount of depth beneath the cutesy surface.

snippet.textDisplay: I was 16 or so when Pokémon came out, and it was definitely one of the best games of its day.  It was good on its own merits.  I wouldn't go back and play the first Pokémons (Red & Blue) today, because I /do/ think it would require some nostalgia to get through (or an appreciation of that retro feel), but I also think that X and Y are great games on their own merits.  Want a pitch?  Novelty.  The game is relentlessly novel, and really deep once you start to dig.
snippet.textOriginal: I was 16 or so when Pokémon came out, and it was definitely one of the best games of its day.  It was good on its own merits.  I wouldn't go back and play the first Pokémons (Red & Blue) today, because I /do/ think it would require some nostalgia to get through (or an appreciation of that retro feel), but I also think that X and Y are great games on their own merits.  Want a pitch?  Novelty.  The game is relentlessly novel, and really deep once you start to dig.

snippet.textDisplay: The Pokemon Origins OVA is pretty good only 4 episodes long but is still pretty decent. During one of the fights one of Red's (the main character) Pokemon gets bite and lets out a horrifying scream and another part I actually started getting teary eyed from it being so sad which is odd b/c normally shows aren't well acted enough for me to care about anything usually. Anyway if you wanna rewatch the entire first season in under 2 hours you could give it a look.

Anyway if you wanna rewatch the entire first season in under 2 hours you could give it a look.

snippet.textDisplay: If there ever was a time to get back into Pokémon, it would be with X and Y, glad to see Gamefreak giving some attention to the old school fans.
snippet.textOriginal: If there ever was a time to get back into Pokémon, it would be with X and Y, glad to see Gamefreak giving some attention to the old school fans.

snippet.textDisplay: The originals definitely had a different feel than the sequels, as the glitches were accessible yet mysterious, and definitely part of the fun. X and Y make a bunch of references to the series's roots, as tons of Kanto pokemon show up in Kalos, the first forest's layout is exactly like the Viridian Forest (and Pikachu is there too), and you get to choose a Kanto starter in addition to your Kalos starter. I think they are good games for old fans who want to get back into the series.
snippet.textOriginal: The originals definitely had a different feel than the sequels, as the glitches were accessible yet mysterious, and definitely part of the fun. X and Y make a bunch of references to the series's roots, as tons of Kanto pokemon show up in Kalos, the first forest's layout is exactly like the Viridian Forest (and Pikachu is there too), and you get to choose a Kanto starter in addition to your Kalos starter. I think they are good games for old fans who want to get back into the series.

snippet.textDisplay:
Objection!

It's one of the best games, because you can make a team of any generation, if you like the first generation you can even pick a starter of Kanto, and they even make a remake of Wild Battle Theme from Red, it plays when you encounter Zapdos, Moltres, Articuno and Mew. It's a great game, even if you like the older generations or the new ones.

snippet.textDisplay: I had great memories of Blue and Red back in school. People would talk strategy and myth (hold up and B to have a better chance of catching Pokeymans!! haha) and play and battle during lunch and recess. Good times. Pokemon was my go to game during the Red/Blue and Silver/Gold era.
snippet.textOriginal: I had great memories of Blue and Red back in school. People would talk strategy and myth (hold up and B to have a better chance of catching Pokeymans!! haha) and play and battle during lunch and recess. Good times. Pokemon was my go to game during the Red/Blue and Silver/Gold era.

snippet.textDisplay:
Still a hardcore Pokemon fan, and yes, X & Y are fantastic! I got X, and I think I can say that it has replaced Platinum as my favorite Pokemon game.

Also, don't be ashamed of your secret. Or, do be, but rest assured that others did things like that also. I used to dance along to the theme of Mirror B. from Pokemon Colosseum and XD: Gale of Darkness. Ehehe.
snippet.textOriginal:
Still a hardcore Pokemon fan, and yes, X & Y are fantastic! I got X, and I think I can say that it has replaced Platinum as my favorite Pokemon game.

Also, don't be ashamed of your secret. Or, do be, but rest assured that others did things like that also. I used to dance along to the theme of Mirror B. from Pokemon Colosseum and XD: Gale of Darkness. Ehehe.

snippet.textDisplay: I remember playing Blue and Yellow growing up.  I especially remember playing it at night with the Wormlight attachment.  Ahh, childhood memories.  Honestly, I'm excited by X and Y, but i really have not seriously played a pokemon game since Ruby.  I also love the music by Masuda, it brings back such incredible memories listening to it 15 years later.  It gives me chills whenever i listen to Pallet Town for an extended period of time.
snippet.textOriginal: I remember playing Blue and Yellow growing up.  I especially remember playing it at night with the Wormlight attachment.  Ahh, childhood memories.  Honestly, I'm excited by X and Y, but i really have not seriously played a pokemon game since Ruby.  I also love the music by Masuda, it brings back such incredible memories listening to it 15 years later.  It gives me chills whenever i listen to Pallet Town for an extended period of time.

snippet.textDisplay: Oh and a shameful secret? I played this game on the Super GameBoy quite a lot, and I still remember how I'd use my Bulbasaur (Venusaur) in battle, stand up and flail my arms in sync with﻿ the Razor Leaf animation. What...? Razor Leaf was awesome.

snippet.textDisplay: Oh hey, this video only took 3 hours to﻿ process! Pokémon pretty much consumed my life for at least 2 years. Mainly this game, but also the Pokémon cards and anime. I was the absolute fanboy back then, I knew everything about its universe (I could name the 151 pokémons, of course). Listening to music like this brings some heavy nostalgia. In a way, it's funny how much a Pokémon fan I was, and how it's been 10 years since I last played a game from its series. I heard X&Y is good!
snippet.textOriginal: Oh hey, this video only took 3 hours to﻿ process! Pokémon pretty much consumed my life for at least 2 years. Mainly this game, but also the Pokémon cards and anime. I was the absolute fanboy back then, I knew everything about its universe (I could name the 151 pokémons, of course). Listening to music like this brings some heavy nostalgia. In a way, it's funny how much a Pokémon fan I was, and how it's been 10 years since I last played a game from its series. I heard X&Y is good!
